lines.text: [first title card]
On August 27, 1930, the entire motion picture industry suspended work to pay tribute to the memory of one of its great actors.
This is his story.
[first lines]
Good morning, Mr. Thalberg.
Good morning.
Who are you? What are you doing here?
I'm from the collection agency. I've come to collect my wife.
The kind of fellows I play, pretty girls don't write to.
Say, Pop! There's a great new joke going around school. "Don't step on that spider. It might be Lon Chaney."
Darling, it's wonderful. But isn't it very painful?
Only when I laugh.
What'd you say?
Huh?
A thousand faces! Thalberg's been after me to start a new advertising campaign. "The Man of a Thousand Faces"! How's that?
Make it 1001 faces, Lon. This is one I've never seen before.
[last lines]
And he asked of us all forgiveness.

[In character of Quasimodo, the Hunchback of Notre, to his estranged wife]
What's the matter, Cleva? Still afraid of freaks?

[after hearing Lon describe his interpretation of Quasimodo]
That's just what I want the audience to see, Mr. Chaney - the soul of a man that Godmade different. If you can get that on fim, we've got ourselves a picture.
If a guy can be enough things in this buusiness, he can make a living.
Now, just listen, don't start spendin' the money. You Still got that face.
I've got a face, Gert, a whole boxful.
Look, Lon, publicity is part of our business. We're not just a goldfish bowl; we're an aquarium. There's no room in the industry for a mystery man. Why, if we wnt...
Man of Mystery!
And you can stop bothering me. Get out!

[Leaving with his feelings stung]
You can make it 1001 faces, Lon. This is one I've never seen before.
We've got to talk about this.
Surprise, Lon, for once I don't want to talk anymore.

[Believing that Chaney has cost her her singing job]
You had me fired! Damn you! Damn you! Damn you!
